title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira's 13-year-old daughter, missing since July, was found safe in Massachusetts, now in DCF custody.
The 17-year-old daughter Nayara Ferreira De Moura remains missing; last seen in June and reported to be in Brazil with an older sister.
Read the quote shaping reactions. Read the full context.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration demands Massachusetts remove 'gender ideology' references from sex ed materials or risk losing $2.36 million in federal funding.
Massachusetts has 60 days to comply with the demand focusing on PREP, a program targeting teen pregnancy and STIs through contraception education.
Release window and episode plan. Read the full context.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão appointed as the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC, moving from Benfica after winning multiple titles.
Patão aims to bring adaptability to the team in the competitive NWSL, aligning strategies with GM Domènec Guasch.
Read what Filipa Patão said about the matchup. Read the full context.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters the 2025-26 NHL season with no contract disputes, aiming to improve after a difficult 2024-25 season.
Swayman modified his offseason training after a career-low save percentage, helped by a strong performance at the IIHF World Championships.
See the number that defines the deal — $66. Read the full context.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face his former team, the Raiders, as Patriots offensive coordinator in Sunday's home opener.
McDaniels expressed no ill will towards the Raiders and praised current head coach Pete Carroll ahead of the game.
How the move changes the lineup is explained. Read the full context.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a limited series about Karen Read's murder case, sparking mixed reactions from readers.
The series, developed by Prime Video and Warner Bros, will explore society's true crime obsession and crisis of trust in institutions.
Full details in the story.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville and Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket ranked 2nd and 3rd among U.S. casinos outside Las Vegas.
USA Today Readers' Choice Awards praised their gaming options, with Mohegan Sun noted for slots and Foxwoods for extensive dining choices.
Full details in the story.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The Pogues and Dropkick Murphys will headline the Seisiún Music Festival at Suffolk Downs on September 6 and 7, 2025.
Tickets range from $75 to $403, available via AXS; limited parking is available with advance purchase required.
One figure reframes the story — $75. Read the full context.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen is accused by staff and members of fostering a toxic workplace and failing to support minority-owned businesses.
CWK's board supports leadership despite allegations, highlighting challenges and efforts to improve operations and maintain its mission.
Full details in the story.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions, including rent control, cleared the first step, with 3 failing the criteria set by state law.
Proposed initiatives require 74,574 signatures by Dec. 3 and additional signatures by July 1 if Legislature doesn't pass them.
Next step is scheduled — agenda details. Read the full context.
